node.title: Girl who hid in Ukraine basement draws her fears to cope with war
node.description: "Houses are burning, tanks are standing. I do not know whether my friends are alive," she said. "...I drew this for myself, for the future, so that later I could see what I experienced."

node.title: Man arrested outside Chris Rock show in Boston
node.description: Kaleb Herd allegedly assaulted a police officer as well as a person he was at the show with who tried to deescalate the incident.

node.title: Russia says Ukraine attacked an oil depot on Russian soil
node.description: The unconfirmed attack would be significant, and it comes as Putin's troops abandon the Chernobyl nuclear plant.

node.title: Pope makes historic apology to Indigenous communities for Canada abuses
node.description: More than 150,000 native children in Canada were forced to attend state-funded Christian schools from the 19th century until the 1970s.

node.title: Jobless rate dips to 3.6% as U.S. employers add 431,000 jobs
node.description: Robust hiring last month pulled the nation's unemployment rate close to its pre-pandemic level.

node.title: House passes bill capping monthly insulin costs at $35 for insured patients
node.description: The bill, which must still pass the Senate, would not help the uninsured.

node.title: Nation's oldest park ranger, Betty Reid Soskin, retires at age 100
node.description: She joined the National Park Service at the ripe young age of 84, at Rosie the Riveter World War II Home Front National Historic Park in Richmond, outside San Francisco.

node.title: Frustration mounts as China extends Shanghai COVID lockdown indefinitely
node.description: China's most populous, wealthiest city was supposed to be shut down in 2 phases for about a week. That's been extended, and it could be extended again.

node.title: Did push-ups and disrespect lead to murder?
node.description: After tech CEO and cannabis entrepreneur Tushar Atre was kidnapped and murdered, investigators zeroed in on two former employees Atre allegedly forced to do push-ups.

node.title: 5 fetuses found inside D.C. home of "anti-abortion activist"
node.description: Lauren Handy, 28, was one of nine people charged in an indictment that was made public on Wednesday.

node.title: Six severed heads left on car roof with sign warning others
node.description: Discoveries of mutilated bodies dumped in public or hung from bridges have increased in Mexico in recent years.

node.title: Pizza shop owner killed partner and hid body for weeks, police say
node.description: Anna Maria Tolomello is accused of shooting Giovanni Gallina in the head. He co-owned the restaurant. His body was found rolled up in tarp in their bedroom, police say.  She's claiming self-defense.

node.title: As rents soar, here's what $1,500 buys you across the U.S.
node.description: The same rent that gets a four-bedroom in Kansas will only pay for a closet-sized apartment in Manhattan.

node.title: The White House diaries and the 7-hour gap in Trump's day on Jan. 6
node.description: Here's what goes into documenting the president's day for posterity â€“  a process that's being examined by the House select committee probing the assault on the Capitol.

node.title: Former Silver Fern Temalisi Fakahokotau signs with UK side
node.description: Former Silver Fern Temalisi Fakahokotau has made a surprise move by joining the Saracens Mavericks for the remainder of the United Kingdom's Vitality Netball Superleague season.

node.title: Sam's Take: Morbius reviewed
node.description: Watch: This week Sam is looking at Sony's latest addition to their Spider-Man cinematic universe, Morbius.

node.title: NZ Automotive Investments earnings hit by rise of NZ dollar against Japanese yen
node.description: A sharp rise in the value of the New Zealand dollar against the Japanese yen has eaten into the earnings for second-hand car dealer NZ Automotive Investments.

node.title: Policing of anti-mandate protest cost more than $430k, excluding wages
node.description: The police operation set up to respond to the illegal occupation at Parliament has cost taxpayers more than $430,000.

node.title: Police searching for David Tuitupou after Auckland shooting
node.description: Police investigating a shooting incident in Auckland last month are appealing for the public's assistance in locating David Tuitupou.

node.title: Doctors suspended over anti-vax claims win court appeals
node.description: Today's judgement says the Medical Council wrongly suspended the two doctors before investigations were completed.

node.title: Two South Korean air force planes collide, killing 3, injuring 1
node.description: The KT-1 trainer aircraft crashed into a mountain in the southeastern city of Sacheon. The crash's cause wasn't immediately known.

node.title: Three times more ASB customers fell for investment scams over past two years
node.description: Data released by ASB this April Fool's Day indicates investment scams, particularly those involving crypto-currency, top list of scams over the past two years.

node.title: Samoa records first Covid-19 related death
node.description: The death in Samoa comes 13 days after the first community transmission case was detected.

node.title: More efficient utes imported due to Clean Car Discount scheme - Transport Minister
node.description: Transport Minister Michael Wood says the introduction of the Clean Car Discount scheme has already seen importers bringing in more efficient utes which attract a lower emissions charge. Audio

node.title: Covid-19 update: 17 deaths, 13,475 cases, 764 in hospital
node.description: The number of people in hospital with Covid-19 continues to fall, but there have still been 13,475 new cases in the community and 17 more deaths reported in New Zealand today.

node.title: Censoring content: Readers reminded not to judge a book by its cover
node.description: Marlborough's libraries will not censor content just because someone takes offence to it.

node.title: Council planning committee considers call to clamp down on helipads on Waiheke
node.description: Auckland councillors are being asked to step in over the safety of helicopter flights over Waiheke Island.

node.title: Turnover of psychologists reaches 60% in some regions - union
node.description: There are 148 vacant psychologist positions across the country in DHBs and the Education Ministry, new data shows.

node.title: National launches troll hunt: Online abuse 'unacceptable'
node.description: Accusations a Young Nat has been trolling female politicians online has prompted an investigation by the National Party, with the abuse denounced as cowardice on all sides.

node.title: Lawmakers close to deal on smaller $10 billion COVID bill
node.description: The legislation would finance vaccines, treatments and tests, as Biden and Democrats have warned that the government is running out of money to pay for the fight against COVID.
